pullrequest.title: Updates to RemoteWorker and similar classes

content.raw:
I love the idea of launching devices present on remote hardware, but I have to say that the proposed syntax looks complicated and counter-intuitive.

In most cases, I would think that I would support the much more transparent syntax:

Most transparent and logical extension to labscript:

    NovaTechDDS9m('nt1', com_port = 'COM1', host='pi-1.physics.monash.edu')
    NovaTechDDS9m('nt2', com_port = 'COM2', host='pi-2.physics.monash.edu')

or perhaps a more flexible, somewhat less clear syntax:

    RemoteBLACS('raspberry_pi_1', 'pi-1.physics.monash.edu')
    RemoteBLACS('raspberry_pi_2', 'pi-2.physics.monash.edu')
    NovaTechDDS9m('nt1', com_port='COM1', host=raspberry_pi_1.RemoteWorker)
    NovaTechDDS9m('nt2', com_port='COM2', host=raspberry_pi_2.RemoteGUI)

or [but I don't like this one as it is pretty opaque]:

    RemoteBLACS('raspberry_pi_1', 'pi-1.physics.monash.edu')
    RemoteBLACS('raspberry_pi_2', 'pi-2.physics.monash.edu')

    NovaTechDDS9m('nt1', host = raspberry_pi_1.RemoteWorker('COM1'))
    NovaTechDDS9m('nt2', host = raspberry_pi_1.RemoteGUI('COM2'))
    NovaTechDDS9m('nt3', host = raspberry_pi_1.RemoteGUI(raspberry_pi_2.RemoteWorker('COM1')))


It seems to me that using the com_port to denote the remote blacs might be a very nice technical solution, but it is really unfriendly.
